title: Region / state roundup : Former Princess Anne High star changes his mind , will transfer to UNLV instead of Michigan State
body_text:
COLLEGE FOOTBALL
Defensive back Tony Grimes, a former Princess Anne High star, has flipped his decision on transferring and will go to UNLV instead of Michigan State, he announced on social media.
The former five-star recruit played three seasons at North Carolina and then transferred to Texas A&M, but he didn’t play last season due to an injury.
- James Madison cornerback D’Angelo Ponds and Liberty defensive end TJ Bush have each been named to the Football Writers Association of America Freshman All-America Team.
WOMEN’S COLLEGE BASKETBALL
Bryant & Stratton women ranked 20th
The Bryant & Stratton College women’s basketball team has moved up to No. 20 in the latest National Junior College Athletic Association Division II rankings. The Bobcats are now 15-1.
HOCKEY
Admirals goalie gets win in all-star game
The ECHL All-Stars defeated the Savannah Ghost Pirates 18-11 in the ECHL All-Star Classic in front of a capacity crowd of 6,795 on Monday night at Enmarket Arena in Savannah, Georgia.
Mitchell Fossier of the Atlanta Gladiators was named the Most Valuable Player of the event with one goal and six assists for the ECHL team.
Norfolk Admirals goalie Thomas Milic picked up the victory, making 10 saves.
- Former Norfolk Admirals goalie Yaniv Perets made his NHL debut with the Carolina Hurricanes on Monday night and had a save on the only shot he faced. Perets replaced starter Antti Raanta late in the Hurricanes’ 5-2 loss to the Los Angeles Kings.
- The ECHL’s Board of Governors has approved the expansion application of Bloomington, Illinois, which will begin play in the 2024-25 season. It will give the league 30 teams and play at Grossinger Motors Arena.
BASEBALL
UVA ranked 14th in D1Baseball poll
Virginia is ranked 14th in the D1Baseball.com preseason poll.
It is the second preseason Top 25 that the Cavaliers have made. UVA is No. 10 in the Perfect Game preseason poll.
Five other ACC teams are ranked in the D1Baseball.com poll: No. 1 Wake Forest, No. 10 Clemson, No. 12 Duke, No. 13 North Carolina State and No. 15 North Carolina.
Nats hire Doolittle as pitching strategist
Former Washington Nationals closer Sean Doolittle was hired by the club as a pitching strategist on Tuesday.
The Nationals said the 37-year-old Doolittle, who announced his retirement as a player in September, will “serve as a liaison between the analytics department and pitching staff while assisting the manager and pitching coach with strategy, mental preparation and mechanics.”
Briefly
- Virginia men’s tennis player James Hopper has been named the ACC Men’s Tennis Player of the Week. The grad student went 2-0 in both singles and doubles in team victories over Liberty and James Madison.
